page.title: 01General Description of area.
page.content: This block is mainly farmland.Most of the crops are grain and cereals. There are two villages Elvington and Sutton-upon-Derwent.All of Elvington is in the block and most of Sutton.A river flows through the middle of the block.The river is called the River Derwent it divides Sutton and Elvington.There is only one bridge between the villages.There is an industrial site on the block with light industry involving mainly agriculture and associated concerns.Sutton and Elvington are quite small villages.There are about 600 people in Elvington and 400 people in Sutton.Although rural,the block and its people are not isolated as the city of York is only 7 miles away.
